Description: Unifacial oval scraper of brown flint: slightly chipped round the edge. The blow used to detach the flake caused a part of the edge to break away. The worked surface is extensively covered by white crust.
Curator's comments: A list of the types of flint implements found in tomb 3505 is given in W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 14-15, but it is so abbreviated as to be of little use.
Acquisition name: Exchanged with: Prof Walter B Emery
